Detailed Description

Condition to signal end of steal operation

This class implements one method for synchronisation between a thief and its victim. When a thief thread has successed to steal work from a victim thread, a condition object may be used to express the synchronization of waiting the end of the execution of all theft works. The condition object may be used to wait multiple thiefs before the victim continue.

A Condition has an internal state that could be accessed using get_state and modify using set. The caller may wait on the condition a particular value of the state using wait method. The caller returns either because the state is equal the waiting state or because the method signal was called to update a new state.

The condition object should be used in conjunction with Util::Condition and Util::Mutex objects.

void Core::Condition::set_priority ( Priority  p  )  [inline]

Set the priority of the condition object. The priority is used to indicate an order to wakeup thread sleeping on condition. The value may be any value between PRIORITY_MIN and PRIORITY_MAX. The highest priority is PRIORITY_MIN.

void Core::Condition::signal (  ) 

Signal the condition This method compute the condition in order to resume the waiting thread, if any. The state of the object could be change using Util::Atomic methods but atomicity is not guaranteed with respect to the scheduling of the waiting thread...

void Core::Condition::wait ( State  state,
Util::Mutex &  mutex,
bool  test_isequal 
)

Wait until the state of the dataflow condition will be equal to state This method should be called by a thread of control that has been attached to a Core::Thread

Parameters:
